item.title: Changing things up with ggplot2 themes
item.description: Are you tired of adding your favorite ggplot2 theme to every data visualization you create in R? Then I have a solution for you! Before you start to create any plots call the theme_set() function with your favorite theme as first argument, e.g. library(ggplot2) theme_set(theme_minimal()) That will ensure all plots you subsequently create will use this theme unless you add a different one. data("mtcars") ggplot(mtcars, aes(hp, mpg, color = wt)) + geom_point() Very handy for lazy people like me.
